Summary I'm currently working at Stanford University as an Administrative Associate supporting twelve doctors in Ophthalmology. My responsibilities include transcribing correspondence and letters, reviewing official mail, scanning and faxing documents, updating doctors’ cv’s, contacting various departments about numerous administrative matters, scheduling and planning business trips, tabulating CME credits, updating society memberships, maintaining faculty and resident on call schedules (including distribution to over 50 people/departments/locations), placing department weekly orders and maintaining the master list of all doctors licenses/credentials for the department. 
 
I love what I do and am always looking for the best way to accomplish any task. I strive to save our department money when making purchases and also look at what products are truly needed not just desired.  
 
This is an exciting area of medicine and the future is bright (no pun intended). Studies on bringing patients from blindness to sight are very interesting. What can be done these days is simply AMAZING! I can't wait to see what is around the next corner for Ophthalmology. Specialties:Purchasing, accounting, HR, contract administration, statistics, event planning Experience Administrative Associate III Stanford University School of Medicine May 2007  – Present (8 years 4 months) Provide all aspects of administrative support for eight doctors. Duties include dictation, answering phones, taking messages and screening and addressing inquiries; composing correspondence and responding to routine requests for information. Manage busy meeting and travel calendars; make travel reservations and process reimbursements. Coordinate and provide logistical support for student, faculty, and other meetings. Establish and maintain paper and computer filing system for each faculty member to track their activity. Prepare faculty on-call schedule. Work with doctors on preparation of grants and special programs. Event Chair, Relay For Life of Sunnyvale 2010 & 2011 American Cancer Society January 2009  –  September 2011  (2 years 9 months) Sunnyvale, CA As the Event Chair my responsibilities are numerous. However, it is an honor to have been chosen by the American Cancer Society to fill this position for two years. 
I hope to double the number of attendees in the next year and triple the money raised. We did very well this year and found that there are more folks out there that we need to reach. My top priority next year is to reach more of our Survivors so we can honor them at our event.
